description: Convert JSON data to binary data

options.name: Convert to CSV
options.description: Transform input data into a CSV file

options.name: Convert to HTML
options.description: Transform input data into a table in an HTML file

options.name: Convert to ICS
options.description: Converts each input item to an ICS event file

options.name: Convert to JSON
options.description: Transform input data into a single or multiple JSON files

options.name: Convert to ODS
options.description: Transform input data into an ODS file

options.name: Convert to RTF
options.description: Transform input data into a table in an RTF file

options.name: Convert to Text File
options.description: Transform input data string into a file

options.name: Convert to XLS
options.description: Transform input data into an Excel file

options.name: Convert to XLSX
options.description: Transform input data into an Excel file

options.name: Move Base64 String to File
options.description: Convert a base64-encoded string into its original file format

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.hint: The name of the output binary field to put the file in

options.name: compression
options.description: Whether to reduce the output file size

options.name: delimiter
options.description: The character to use to separate fields

options.name: fileName
options.description: Name of the output file

options.name: headerRow
options.description: Whether the first row of the file contains the header names

options.name: sheetName
options.description: Name of the sheet to create in the spreadsheet

properties.name: sourceProperty
properties.description: The name of the input field that contains the base64 string to convert to a file. Use dot-notation for deep fields (e.g. 'level1.level2.currentKey').

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.hint: The name of the output binary field to put the file in

options.description: Whether to add special marker at the start of your text file. This marker helps some programs understand how to read the file correctly.
options.name: addBOM
dataIsBase64
options.description: Whether the data is already base64 encoded

options.name: encoding
options.description: Choose the character set to use to encode the data

options.name: fileName
options.description: Name of the output file

options.name: mimeType
options.description: The MIME type of the output file. Common MIME types.

properties.name: sourceProperty
properties.description: The name of the input field that contains a string to convert to a file. Use dot-notation for deep fields (e.g. 'level1.level2.currentKey').

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.hint: The name of the output binary field to put the file in

options.description: Whether to add special marker at the start of your text file. This marker helps some programs understand how to read the file correctly.
options.name: addBOM
encoding
options.description: Choose the character set to use to encode the data

options.name: fileName
options.description: Name of the output file

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.hint: The name of the output binary field to put the file in

options.name: addBOM
options.description: Whether to add special marker at the start of your text file. This marker helps some programs understand how to read the file correctly.

options.name: format
options.description: Whether to format the JSON data for easier reading

options.name: encoding
options.description: Choose the character set to use to encode the data

options.name: fileName
options.description: Name of the output file

properties.name: start
properties.description: Date and time at which the event begins. (For all-day events, the time will be ignored.).

properties.name: end
properties.description: Date and time at which the event ends. (For all-day events, the time will be ignored.).
properties.hint: If not set, will be equal to the start date

properties.name: allDay
properties.description: Whether the event lasts all day or not

properties.name: binaryPropertyName
properties.hint: The name of the output binary field to put the file in
properties.description: The field that your iCalendar file will be available under in the output

values.name: rsvp
values.description: Whether the attendee has to confirm attendance or not

options.name: busyStatus
options.description: Used to specify busy status for Microsoft applications, like Outlook

options.name: calName
options.description: Specifies the calendar (not event) name. Used by Apple iCal and Microsoft Outlook. More info.

options.name: fileName
options.description: The name of the file to be generated. Default name is event.ics.

options.name: location
options.description: The intended venue

options.name: recurrenceRule
options.description: A rule to define the repeat pattern of the event (RRULE). (Rule generator).

options.name: sequence
options.description: When sending an update for an event (with the same uid), defines the revision sequence number

options.name: uid
options.description: Universally unique ID for the event (will be auto-generated if not specified here). Should be globally unique.

options.name: url
options.description: URL associated with event

options.name: useWorkflowTimezone
options.description: Whether to use the workflow timezone set in node's settings rather than UTC

name: n8n-nodes-base.convertToFile
